text: March unemployment rates ranged from 2.9% (NE, SD, UT, VT) to 9.0% (HI).
Only IA, SD, UT, and WA saw an increase in GDP from Q4 2019 to Q4 2020.
In Q4 2020, nine states saw annual house price growth over 10% for the first time in three decades.
Leisure and hospitality jobs were down 25% or more over the year in five states and DC.
State and local government jobs declined at least 5% over the year in 29 states.
Average private weekly earnings in March ranged from $769 in MS to $1,829 in DC.
Retail employment in March 2021 was higher than in March 2020 for 13 states.
Nevada’s unemployment rate was 8.1% in March 2021, down from 29.5% in March 2020.
NY’s accommodation and food services GDP fell 46% between Q4 2019 and Q4 2020.
From Q4 2019 to Q4 2020, house price increases ranged from 1.5% in DC to 21.1% in ID.
Manufacturing GDP increased in 44 states and DC between Q3 2020 and Q4 2020.
